title: Furniture Delivery and Recycling Collection Service

After flights land, vehicles collect used equipment and return it to depots. Each gate has strict time windows (`<time_windows>`) synchronized with flight schedules. Linehaul deliveries must occur before backhaul pickups, and vehicle capacities (`<capacity>`) must accommodate mixed equipment types. The goal is to minimize equipment downtime and optimize multi-depot routing to handle peak flight activity efficiently.  
```  

Each scenario integrates **Capacity (C)**, **Multi-Depots (MD)**, **Backhauls (B)**, and **Time Windows (TW)** while exploring novel contexts like disaster response, event logistics, healthcare, agriculture, and aviation.

title: Maritime Port Container Redistribution Network
content: A port authority operates multiple terminals (`<loc_depot>`) managing container logistics. Containers require delivery to export zones (`<loc_customer>`) and pickup of empty containers from import zones, adhering to vessel arrival/departure time windows (`<time_windows>`). Each truck (`capacity: <capacity>`) must prioritize linehaul deliveries before backhauling empties, ensuring no overloads. The challenge is to coordinate depot assignments, respect strict time windows for vessel schedules, and optimize routes to minimize port congestion and fuel costs.

title: Urban Mobility Scooter Redistribution with Battery Swaps
content: A scooter-sharing company uses decentralized hubs (`<loc_depot>`) to manage vehicle distribution. During peak hours (`<time_windows>`), scooters must be delivered to high-demand areas (`<loc_customer>`) and empty batteries collected for recharging. Each van (`capacity: <capacity>`) must first restock scooters before retrieving depleted units. The goal is to balance depot workloads, respect service time windows for recharging shifts, and prevent vehicle overloads to ensure timely redistribution.

title: Hospital Sterilization Equipment Maintenance Logistics
content: A healthcare network deploys sterilized surgical tools from central sterilization depots (`<loc_depot>`) to hospitals (`<loc_customer>`), while simultaneously collecting contaminated instruments for decontamination. Each medical transport vehicle (`capacity: <capacity>`) must deliver linehaul loads first before backhauling hazardous waste. Time windows (`<time_windows>`) align with hospital shift schedules to avoid disrupting surgeries. The problem requires minimizing travel distance while ensuring capacity constraints and strict contamination protocols are maintained.

title: Agricultural Pesticide Delivery and Empty Container Recycling
content: Agricultural suppliers distribute pesticide containers (`<demand_linehaul>`) from regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to farms (`<loc_customer>`) and collect empty containers (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. Trucks (`capacity: <capacity>`) must deliver pesticides before backhauling empties, avoiding capacity breaches. Time windows (`<time_windows>`) ensure deliveries occur when farms are operational to prevent crop exposure during spraying. The solution must balance depot assignments and route efficiency to reduce environmental impact and costs.

title: Event Venue Infrastructure Deployment and Dismantling
content: An events company manages multiple depots (`<loc_depot>`) for temporary infrastructure (e.g., stages, lighting). Equipment must be deployed (`<demand_linehaul>`) to event sites (`<loc_customer>`) before setup deadlines and retrieved (`<demand_backhaul>`) after events end (`<time_windows>`). Vehicles (`capacity: <capacity>`) must first deliver equipment before dismantling and collecting gear. The challenge is to coordinate depot resource allocation, respect strict time windows for event timelines, and optimize routes to minimize overtime labor costs.

title: Urban Garden Supply and Compost Collection Network
content: A citywide initiative to support community gardens requires a logistics system to deliver compostable mulch and gardening tools (linehaul) to 15 urban garden sites while collecting organic waste for municipal composting (backhaul). Multiple depots are located in each district to minimize travel time. Each garden has a strict operational window (e.g., 8–10 AM for deliveries before volunteers arrive, 3–5 PM for waste pickup after maintenance). Delivery trucks with a <capacity> kg capacity must prioritize mulch/tool deliveries before returning to collect waste, ensuring no overloading during the round trip.

title: High-Speed Rail Maintenance and Parts Recycling Network
content: A railway operator must deploy technicians and replacement parts to 20 regional train stations (linehaul) while retrieving worn-out components for recycling (backhaul). Maintenance depots in major cities serve as hubs for this network. Each station has a 2-hour maintenance window (e.g., 2–4 AM) during which parts must be delivered before technicians begin repairs. Defective parts are collected afterward, with trucks adhering to strict capacity limits for both outbound and return cargo.

title: Pop-Up Retail Event Equipment Deployment and Collection
content: A global brand hosts 30 pop-up stores in shopping malls across the country. Equipment such as modular displays and inventory (linehaul) must be delivered to each location before opening hours (e.g., 6–8 AM), while empty crates and disassembled fixtures (backhaul) are collected post-event (e.g., 9–11 PM). Regional depots in key cities coordinate logistics, with trucks limited to <capacity> cubic meters. Deliveries must precede pickups to ensure stores open on time, and routes must respect mall loading dock access schedules.

title: Aircraft Maintenance Parts Delivery and Return Network
content: An airline operates out of four hub airports (depots), supplying critical spare parts to 40 regional airports (linehaul) and retrieving defective components (backhaul). Each airport has a 90-minute maintenance window (e.g., 12–1:30 PM) during aircraft downtime. Parts must be delivered before mechanics begin work, with defective parts collected afterward. Trucks are restricted to <capacity> kg to balance part weight and containerized returns, requiring precise sequencing to avoid capacity breaches.

title: Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Waste Collection System
content: A coastal aquaculture cooperative delivers fish feed (linehaul) to 25 marine farming sites while collecting waste byproducts (backhaul) for biogas production. Depots in three coastal cities manage logistics, with delivery windows tied to tidal patterns (e.g., low tide at 10 AM for feed distribution, high tide at 4 PM for waste retrieval). Trucks must first deliver feed without exceeding <capacity> kg, then return to collect waste in sealed containers, ensuring compliance with environmental regulations and vessel weight limits.

title: Offshore Wind Farm Maintenance and Component Recycling Network
content: A renewable energy company must service offshore wind turbines across multiple marine zones. Maintenance teams depart from coastal depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver replacement parts (`<demand_linehaul>`) to turbines (`<loc_customer>`), then retrieve decommissioned components (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. Each turbine has strict maintenance windows (`<time_windows>`) tied to weather and tidal conditions, while service vessels (`<capacity>`) must prioritize deliveries before pickups to avoid overloading. The goal is to optimize routes across depots, respect time constraints, and ensure efficient recycling of turbine parts.

title: Mobile Healthcare Clinic Deployment and Medical Waste Collection
content: A nonprofit operates mobile health clinics from regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to provide care in underserved areas. Clinics must deliver medical supplies (`<demand_linehaul>`) to remote villages (`<loc_customer>`) by specific appointment times (`<time_windows>`), then collect biohazard waste (`<demand_backhaul>`) for disposal. Vehicles (`<capacity>`) must complete deliveries before waste pickups to avoid contamination. The challenge is balancing clinic schedules, depot assignments, and capacity limits while minimizing travel time for urgent health services.

title: High-Tech Server Farm Equipment Delivery and E-Waste Pickup
content: A global tech firm uses data center depots (`<loc_depot>`) to upgrade server farms. Engineers must deliver new servers (`<demand_linehaul>`) to facilities (`<loc_customer>`) during scheduled downtime (`<time_windows>`), then retrieve obsolete hardware (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. Delivery trucks (`<capacity>`) must avoid mixing old and new equipment to prevent damage, requiring strict sequence adherence. The objective is to minimize downtime and operational costs while managing multi-depot logistics for global operations.

title: International Flower Export Logistics with Perishable Deliveries and Crate Returns
content: A floral exporter ships time-sensitive cut flowers (`<demand_linehaul>`) from regional distribution centers (`<loc_depot>`) to international airports (`<loc_customer>`), ensuring blooms arrive before expiration (`<time_windows>`). Refrigerated trucks (`<capacity>`) then return empty crates (`<demand_backhaul>`) to depots. Routes must prioritize deliveries before pickups to prevent overloading and comply with perishable cargo regulations. The goal is to maximize flower freshness while optimizing crate reuse across multiple depots.

title: Major Sports Tournament Equipment Deployment and Venue Retrieval
content: A sports league deploys equipment to venues (`<loc_customer>`) for a continental tournament, using regional logistics hubs (`<loc_depot>`). Teams must deliver goalposts, scoreboards, and safety gear (`<demand_linehaul>`) by setup deadlines (`<time_windows>`), then retrieve all items post-event (`<demand_backhaul>`). Vehicles (`<capacity>`) must complete venue setups before equipment pickups to avoid delays. The challenge is synchronizing multi-depot operations with tight tournament schedules and venue-specific capacity constraints.

title: Renewable Energy Solar Panel Deployment and Recycling Network
content: A solar energy company operates multiple regional depots (<loc_depot>) to deploy new photovoltaic panels to remote installations (<loc_customer>) while collecting outdated panels for recycling. Each truck has a capacity limit (<capacity>) to handle both deliveries (linehaul) and pickups (backhaul). Solar installations require delivery during daylight hours (time window <time_windows>), while recycling centers operate only during specific shifts. The goal is to optimize routes so trucks first deliver new panels within their designated time slots, then return to depots via paths that collect old panels without exceeding weight limits or missing facility operating hours.

title: International Event Staging Logistics with Venue-Specific Deadlines
content: A global events firm manages multi-city festivals using depots in key hubs (<loc_depot>). Trucks must deliver stage equipment (linehaul) to venues (<loc_customer>) before setup deadlines (<time_windows_open>) and later retrieve gear after events conclude (<time_windows_close>). Backhaul pickups must follow linehaul deliveries, and vehicle capacities (<capacity>) must accommodate both heavy equipment and bulky dismantled materials. The challenge is synchronizing depot assignments with venue schedules to avoid penalties for late arrivals or overloads during cross-country transfers.

title: Airport Cargo Shuttle Network with Flight-Specific Time Constraints
content: An airport logistics provider uses terminals (<loc_depot>) as hubs to load perishable cargo (linehaul) onto outgoing flights and collect returned shipments (backhaul). Each flight has strict loading windows (<time_windows>), and cargo trucks must prioritize deliveries before pickups to respect aircraft departure times. With limited truck capacities (<capacity>), planners must balance payload mixes of outbound goods (e.g., fresh produce) and inbound returns (e.g., electronics) while minimizing detours between terminals and gate locations.

title: Urban Vertical Farm Supply and Compost Retrieval System
content: A network of rooftop farms in a city (<loc_customer>) relies on decentralized depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver hydroponic nutrients (linehaul) and collect organic waste for composting (backhaul). Delivery trucks must service farms during early morning hours (<time_windows>) to avoid heat stress on crops, while compost pickups align with waste processing plant schedules. Vehicle capacities (<capacity>) must handle perishable supplies and bulky compost bins, requiring routes that first restock farms before returning to depots via optimal backhaul paths.

title: Disaster Zone Medical Drone Delivery and Battery Rotation
content:
In post-disaster zones, medical aid drones are deployed from mobile depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver emergency supplies (linehaul) and collect used medical waste (backhaul). Each drone has a limited flight range (<capacity>), requiring mid-mission battery swaps at temporary charging hubs. Delivery routes must adhere to strict time windows (<time_windows>) for patient care, while pickups of contaminated materials must follow linehaul completions. The challenge is coordinating depot rotations, battery logistics, and time-critical deliveries across fragmented terrain.  
```

title: Offshore Wind Farm Maintenance and Tool Retrieval Network
content: Offshore wind farm operators must dispatch service crews from multiple coastal depots (`<loc_depot>`) to turbines scattered across marine zones. Each turbine requires maintenance tools and spare parts (`<demand_linehaul>`) delivered within strict operational windows (`<time_windows>`), dictated by tidal conditions and safety protocols. After repairs, crews collect used tools and defective components (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. Vessels (`<capacity> ton capacity`) must return to their origin depots, adhering to service times (`<service_time>`) and avoiding overloading. Routes must balance depot workloads while ensuring timely turbine servicing to prevent energy output losses.

title: Agricultural Drone Battery Delivery and Collection System
content: Agricultural tech firms operate regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to support crop-monitoring drones across farmland. Farmers (`<loc_customer>`) need fresh batteries (`<demand_linehaul>`) delivered within their daily operational hours (`<time_windows>`), while depleted batteries (`<demand_backhaul>`) are collected afterward. Delivery drones and trucks (`<capacity> kg capacity`) must return to their assigned depots, avoiding overloading. Routes must prioritize urgent battery swaps for irrigation systems and pest control drones, with service times (`<service_time>`) accounting for battery swaps at farms.

title: Temporary Medical Field Hospital Setup and Equipment Retrieval
content: Disaster response teams deploy modular medical facilities to crisis zones (`<loc_customer>`) using depots (`<loc_depot>`) as regional hubs. Critical medical equipment (`<demand_linehaul>`) must reach affected areas within life-saving time windows (`<time_windows>`), while post-mission gear (`<demand_backhaul>`) is retrieved for sterilization. Mobile medical units (`<capacity> ton capacity`) must return to their origin depots, adhering to strict decontamination protocols (`<service_time>`). Routes must avoid overloading vehicles and ensure rapid deployment to high-priority zones.

title: Cruise Liner Provisioning and Waste Disposal Logistics
content: Cruise line operators manage multiple port depots (`<loc_depot>`) to supply ships (`<loc_customer>`) with perishables (`<demand_linehaul>`) during short port stays (`<time_windows>`). Simultaneously, they collect waste and recyclables (`<demand_backhaul>`) before departure. Tender boats (`<capacity> ton capacity`) must return to their assigned ports, coordinating with ship schedules and adhering to maritime waste regulations (`<service_time>`). Routes must optimize fuel use while avoiding delays due to overloaded vessels or missed time windows.

title: Museum Artifact Transportation and Crate Recycling Network
content: A global art consortium uses regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to transport fragile artifacts (`<demand_linehaul>`) to temporary exhibitions (`<loc_customer>`). Delivery must occur within museum installation windows (`<time_windows>`), and empty crates (`<demand_backhaul>`) are collected post-exhibition for reuse. Climate-controlled trucks (`<capacity> m³ capacity`) must return to origin depots, ensuring artifact security (`<service_time>`) during loading/unloading. Routes must balance depot resource allocation while minimizing exposure to environmental risks during transit.

title: Conference AV Equipment Deployment and Retrieval Network
content: A global event management firm operates multiple regional depots (`<loc_depot>`) to supply audiovisual equipment to conference venues (`<loc_customer>`). Each vehicle (`capacity: <capacity>`) must first deliver projectors, screens, and sound systems (linehaul demand `<demand_linehaul>`) to venues before their event start times (`time window: <time_windows>`). After events conclude, trucks collect equipment (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) without exceeding capacity limits. Vehicles must return to their origin depot, balancing workload across depots while adhering to strict venue setup deadlines.

title: Disaster Zone Medical Supply and Contaminated Waste Management
content: Medical NGOs deploy from multiple emergency depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver critical supplies (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) like oxygen cylinders and vaccines to disaster-affected zones (`<loc_customer>`). Each location has a time window (`<time_windows>`) for urgent delivery. After aid distribution, trucks must collect contaminated waste (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) for safe disposal. Vehicles (`capacity: <capacity>`) must prioritize capacity constraints to avoid overloading while ensuring rapid response to high-priority zones.

title: Tech Repair Chain Equipment Exchange Network
content: A nationwide electronics repair company uses regional service centers (`<loc_depot>`) to dispatch replacement devices (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) to customers during their scheduled service windows (`<time_windows>`). Technicians then collect faulty equipment (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling, ensuring trucks (`capacity: <capacity>`) don’t exceed weight limits. Routes must be optimized to minimize idle time between depot departures and customer visits while maintaining strict depot-to-depot return policies.

title: Live Event AV Network with Multi-Location Deployment
content: A live entertainment logistics firm manages multiple depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deploy lighting rigs, stages, and sound systems (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) to concert venues (`<loc_customer>`). Each venue requires setup completion within a narrow time window (`<time_windows>`) before performances. After events, trucks retrieve equipment (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) while respecting vehicle capacity (`<capacity>`). The system must dynamically assign depots to minimize cross-regional travel and ensure timely depot returns.

title: Mobile Medical Testing Unit Logistics Network
content:
A public health organization operates mobile testing units from distributed depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver PPE, reagents, and lab kits (linehaul `<demand_linehaul>`) to testing sites (`<loc_customer>`). Sites must receive supplies before their operational start times (`<time_windows>`). Post-testing, trucks collect biohazard waste and used materials (backhaul `<demand_backhaul>`) without exceeding capacity (`<capacity>`). The network must balance depot assignments and time-critical pickups/deliveries to maximize testing coverage during outbreaks.  
```

title: University Campus Academic Supply and E-Waste Collection
content: A university network operates multiple campus warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver lab equipment, textbooks, and research materials (`<demand_linehaul>`) to academic departments while collecting outdated electronics and hazardous e-waste (`<demand_backhaul>`). Each department has restricted access hours (`<time_windows>`) during staff availability. Vehicles must first complete deliveries without exceeding `<capacity>` limits before collecting waste, optimizing routes across depots to meet academic schedules and environmental compliance targets.

title: Rural Health Clinic Medical Supply Distribution and Waste Management
content: A regional health authority uses decentralized distribution hubs (`<loc_depot>`) to supply remote clinics with vaccines, medications, and medical kits (`<demand_linehaul>`) while retrieving expired drugs and biohazardous waste (`<demand_backhaul>`). Clinics mandate service during specific operating hours (`<time_windows>`), requiring precise timing. Vehicles must first deliver supplies within `<capacity>` constraints before collecting waste, balancing multi-depot logistics to ensure healthcare access and regulatory adherence.

title: Urban Pharmacy Home Delivery and Medical Waste Collection
content: A city’s pharmacy network operates from multiple urban depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver prescription medications (`<demand_linehaul>`) to patients’ homes and collect used syringes, sharps, and expired pills (`<demand_backhaul>`). Deliveries must align with patients’ specified time windows (`<time_windows>`) for medication schedules. Vehicles must first complete deliveries without exceeding `<capacity>` before collecting waste, ensuring efficient multi-depot coordination and compliance with health regulations.

title: Spaceport Rocket Component Delivery and Used Parts Retrieval
content: A space logistics firm coordinates with launch facilities (`<loc_depot>`) to transport rocket components (`<demand_linehaul>`) to assembly pads and retrieve spent engines and propellant tanks (`<demand_backhaul>`). Each launch site imposes stringent time windows (`<time_windows>`) tied to orbital windows. Vehicles must first deliver parts within `<capacity>` limits before collecting waste, synchronizing multi-depot operations to avoid mission delays and environmental risks.

title: Offshore Oil Rig Supply and Hazardous Waste Removal
content:
Maritime logistics teams service offshore oil rigs (`<loc_customer>`) from coastal depots (`<loc_depot>`), delivering machinery, fuel, and safety equipment (`<demand_linehaul>`) while collecting drilling waste, contaminated fluids, and obsolete parts (`<demand_backhaul>`). Rigs require supplies during weather-safe windows (`<time_windows>`), necessitating precise scheduling. Vehicles must first deliver items within `<capacity>` constraints before retrieving waste, optimizing routes across depots to minimize downtime and environmental impact.  
```

title: International Exhibition Stand Logistics with Equipment Retrieval
content: A global trade show organizer coordinates multi-national exhibitors across several cities. Teams operate from regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver custom display materials (linehaul, `<demand_linehaul>`) to exhibition halls (`<loc_customer>`) within strict setup deadlines (`<time_windows>`). After the event, they must collect dismantled equipment (backhaul, `<demand_backhaul>`) without overloading trucks (`<capacity>`). Vehicles must return to their origin depot while balancing regional depot workloads and adhering to venue access hours.

title: Urban Food Truck Network with Waste Collection
content: A city’s food truck network uses distributed commissary kitchens (`<loc_depot>`) to supply fresh ingredients (linehaul, `<demand_linehaul>`) to mobile vendors (`<loc_customer>`) before their operating windows open (`<time_windows>`). Trucks then collect bio-waste and used containers (backhaul, `<demand_backhaul>`) from the trucks after service hours. Each vehicle must prioritize deliveries before pickups while managing perishable load limits (`<capacity>`), ensuring no depot’s fleet is overtasked.

title: Offshore Oil Rig Tool Supply and Empty Container Retrieval
content: Offshore oil platforms (`<loc_customer>`) require precision tool deliveries (linehaul, `<demand_linehaul>`) from coastal supply hubs (`<loc_depot>`) during tidal-safe access windows (`<time_windows>`). After operations, empty protective containers (backhaul, `<demand_backhaul>`) must be retrieved. High seas restrict vessel capacity (`<capacity>`), requiring route planning that clusters rig visits by depot proximity while ensuring tools are delivered before retrieval tasks.

title: University Campus Event Equipment Deployment and Return
content: A university’s event management team uses multiple campus storage depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deploy AV equipment (linehaul, `<demand_linehaul>`) to lecture halls and stadiums (`<loc_customer>`) by scheduled event start times (`<time_windows>`). After events, they must collect the gear (backhaul, `<demand_backhaul>`) without exceeding van capacities (`<capacity>`). Each vehicle must return to its origin depot, balancing logistical demands across academic departments.

title: High-Speed Rail Maintenance Parts Delivery and废旧部件回收
content: Railway maintenance crews operate from regional repair depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver critical parts (linehaul, `<demand_linehaul>`) to trackside repair sites (`<loc_customer>`) during scheduled downtime (`<time_windows>`). They then collect废旧部件 (backhaul, `<demand_backhaul`) for recycling. Vehicles must respect weight limits (`<capacity>`) and depot-specific service areas, ensuring parts arrive before maintenance windows close while optimizing cross-depot resource allocation.
